channel.title: Internet Connection
channel.description: So, my brothers friend had a virus on his computer, and it was slow as fuck. So, what I did was delete his current OS, and reinstall it. His Internet connection wouldn't work before, so I thought it was a virus blocking it or some shit. It's a Dell Latitude D520; the wireless won't work. It doesn't show any Internet connections or anything in the taskbar. It only shows "Windows Security Alerts," and "Safely Remove Hardware." I tried plugging it in my router, and it still didn't show up any Internet connections. Fresh install of Windows XP Home Edition X86. Any ideas? I gotta give it to him tomorrow. :|

item.title: Internet Connection
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

Lmfao, I tried about everything. Nothing would work. It doesn’t have anything for wireless, then I found it. I clicked the setup but nothing for my router or anything.

Read full topic

item.title: Internet Connection
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

I’m actually doing this in work now, have to downgrade windows 7 to XP then install everything and connect to the network.

A lot of work for one computer, and I got another 5 left.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“Rash, post:3, topic:387457”]If the driver installed?[/quote]Was about to say this.

No driver, no icon at the taskbar.

item.description:
@rash wrote:

If the driver installed?

item.title: Internet Connection
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

Control panel > Network connections and configure another one.

Read full topic
